page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY OF CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: Fourteen people were interviewed. They had lived in Cruden Bay all or almost all their lives, Most people in Cruden Bay went to Port Erroll School. They used slates instead of jotters. In their spare time some played football or golf. Cruden Bay had a lot of herring boats long ago. People left school when they were fourteen. Some got jobs like fishermen. The pay was 1O shillings a week. Others worked in the local hotels or in the laundry. Few people remembered the castle being occupied, however many could recall the famous peole who came to the large Cruden Bay Hotel in the 1920's and 30's. The Hotel was taken over by the army during the war and closed in 1948. After that the Hotel was demolished. All interviewed said they liked Cruden Bay long ago.
